description.narrative: Sanitation and Hygiene/CATS: Community approaches to sanitation scaled up, nation-wide with increased capacity at national level and in 5 counties to plan, budget and monitor sanitation programmes, informed by innovative approaches to promote hygiene and sanitation.

sector.narrative: Risk management and resilience/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in peri-urban and urban communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration
Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Sanitation and Hygiene/CATS: Community approaches to sanitation scaled up, nation-wide with increased capacity at national level and in 5 counties to plan, budget and monitor sanitation programmes, informed by innovative approaches to promote hygiene and sanitation.

description.narrative: 1,116 villages achieved Open Defecation Free (ODF) certification. Siaya county became the second ODF county in Kenya. UNICEF and the Ministry of Health strengthened the capacity of 19 Counties on reporting the progress towards county ODF through the web-based real-time monitoring system supported by UNICEF in 2017. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/06/2018

title.narrative: of MIS established for real time monitoring of community led sanitation
Number of counties implementing a county-wide ODF plan
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Annual budget for basic sanitation

actual.value: 2016:No update available; KCO is tracking county expenditure and the PER that will be complete by year end may provide data; in 2017 WHO will undertake a WASH expenditure tracking case study in Kenya

title.narrative: Number of communities certified free of open defecation in the reporting year only as a result of UNICEF direct support
